poem:
Title: Theatre of Ironies

Once a hero, draped in Trump's rhetoric,
Stands shackled, on the stage of justice.
A 'narco-state' in the spotlight, tragicomic tale unfolds,
Of a world bled dry, where trust erodes. 
From lavish praise to a damning vise,
The ex-Honduran leader pays his price.
Wakefulness swift, in a world knotted with deceits,
Where heroes fall and irony greets.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ex-Honduran leader praised by Trump faces trial in US for running ‘narco-state’ Five years after he was lavished with praise by Donald Trump for “stopping drugs at a level that has never happened” – and two years after he was extradited in shackles to the US – the former Honduras president Juan Orlando Hernández is to stand trial in New York on Monday, accused of overseeing a “narco-state” and accepting millions in bribes from drug". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
